alert.note: Alert for Coke; Irion; Nolan; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 10 at 12:55AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coke, Sterling, southern Nolan, northern Tom Green and northern Irion Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 1253 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from central Nolan County, southwest through northwestern Coke County into southern Sterling County. These storms were moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Sterling City, Blackwell, Bronte, Maryneal, Orient, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Water Valley, Grape Creek, Carlsbad, Silver, Fort Chadbourne, Broome, Sanco, Tennyson, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53 and Oak Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coke; Irion; Nolan; Sterling; Tom Green
